words.meaning: 舒适 vt. 使舒适，安慰
vi. 交流，交际 v. 表达；传达
议论；评论; v. 表达意见
从……以来；自从 conj. 从……以来；由于；既然
足够的；充分的 adv. 足够地；充分地 n. 足够；充分
放；安置；树立(榜样); 创造(纪录)

words.example: This is a common pattern in English grammar.
A mass of students gathered in the hall.
He dare not speak in public.
You should handle the problem carefully.
The school has a new policy this year.
You ought to finish your homework first.
He worked like a superman to finish the project.
The sky looks like heaven at sunset.
I have sth. important to tell you, that is, sth. interesting.
This is a compound word made up of two words.
He is a handsome young man.

phrases.meaning: v. 需要做某事(实义动词)

phrases.example: Go and see what is happening outside.

phrases.meaning: 红色的那个（one 代替前面提到的名词）
phrases.example: I like the red one, not the blue one.
Please keep in mind that practice is important.

phrases.meaning: 摸某人的头（介词 on 表示接触部位）
phrases.example: In some countries, you shouldn't touch sb. on the head.

phrases.meaning: 应该有……（there be 句型与 should 连用）
phrases.example: There should be more trees in the city.
Students should follow the rules at school.

phrases.meaning: 最好不要做某事（表示劝告或警告）
phrases.example: You had better not stay up too late.

phrases.meaning: 过去常常做某事（used to 的强调或疑问形式）
phrases.example: Did you use to play here when you were a child?

phrases.meaning: 习惯于做某事（强调逐渐适应的过程）
phrases.example: He is getting used to getting up early.
She dared to speak in front of everyone.
I don't dare to ask him that question.
You should set a goal for this term.

phrases.meaning: 重要的某事（形容词后置）
phrases.example: I have sth. important to tell you.

grammar.title: 情态动词
grammar.definition: 表示说话人的语气或态度的动词，后接动词原形，没有人称和数的变化。
grammar.structure: 主语 + 情态动词 + 动词原形
usage: can/could 表能力、许可、可能：I can swim. / Could you help me?
may/might 表许可、可能：May I come in? / It may rain.
must 表必须、肯定推测：You must finish it. / He must be at home.
should 表应该、建议：You should study hard.
need 表需要（否定needn't）：You needn't worry.

mistakes.wrong: He can swims.
mistakes.correct: He can swim.
mistakes.explanation: 情态动词后接动词原形，不加-s

mistakes.wrong: Must I finish it? — No, you mustn't.
mistakes.correct: Must I finish it? — No, you needn't/don't have to.
mistakes.explanation: must的否定回答用needn't或don't have to，mustn't表禁止

mistakes.wrong: He must be not at home.
mistakes.correct: He can't be at home.
mistakes.explanation: must be的否定是can't be，不是must not be

examples: You must hand in your homework on time.

grammar.title: 一般疑问句
grammar.definition: 用yes或no回答的疑问句，通常将助动词、be动词或情态动词放在主语前。
grammar.structure: 助动词/Be动词/情态动词 + 主语 + 动词(原形) + 其他?
usage: be动词开头：Are you a student? — Yes, I am. / No, I'm not.
助动词开头：Do you like English? — Yes, I do. / No, I don't.
情态动词开头：Can you swim? — Yes, I can. / No, I can't.
回答要与问句保持一致

mistakes.wrong: Does he likes music?
mistakes.correct: Does he like music?
mistakes.explanation: does后面动词要用原形

mistakes.wrong: Are you a teacher? — Yes, you are.
mistakes.correct: Are you a teacher? — Yes, I am.
mistakes.explanation: 回答时主语要变换，you变I

mistakes.wrong: Do you can swim?
mistakes.correct: Can you swim?
mistakes.explanation: 情态动词can不能与do连用

examples: Is she your sister? — Yes, she is.
Did you finish your homework? — No, I didn't.

sub_topics.title: 一般疑问句的构成（助动词/系动词提前）
sub_topics.definition: 通过提前助动词或be动词构成
usage: 用于提问

sub_topics.title: be动词与助动词的区分
sub_topics.definition: be动词本身可提前，实义动词需助动词
usage: 构成疑问或否定

sub_topics.title: 一般疑问句的构成（do/does/did）
sub_topics.definition: pr.邀请某人做某事

sub_topics.title: 一般疑问句的构成
sub_topics.definition: 将助动词或系动词提前构成疑问句。
sub_topics.structure: 助动词/系动词 + 主语 + 动词
usage: 询问信息

sub_topics.title: 一般疑问句：助动词/系动词提前
sub_topics.definition: 使某人变得……

sub_topics.title: 一般疑问句：do/does/did + 主语 + 动词原形
sub_topics.definition: 使某人变得……

sub_topics.title: 一般疑问句的构成方法
sub_topics.definition: pr.从后到前

sub_topics.title: 一般疑问句的构成（助动词do/does/did提前）
一般疑问句的构成规则
一般疑问句：助动词提前

grammar.title: 否定句
grammar.definition: 表示否定意义的句子
grammar.structure: be not / do not
usage: 注意助动词

sub_topics.title: 否定句：助动词 + not
sub_topics.definition: 使某人变得……

grammar.title: 固定搭配辨析
grammar.definition: 指某些词语在长期使用中形成固定组合，搭配不可随意更换，需要整体记忆。
grammar.structure: 动词/形容词/名词 + 固定介词或副词
usage: 不能随意替换其中的介词或副词
意义往往不同于单个词义简单相加
常见于动词短语和习惯表达

grammar.title: There be句型
grammar.definition: 表示'某处存在某人或某物'的句型，be动词的形式由后面最近的名词决定（就近原则）。
grammar.structure: There + be(is/are/was/were) + 主语 + 地点/时间状语
usage: 表示存在：There is a book on the desk.
就近原则：There is a pen and two books on the desk.
各种时态：There will be / There has been / There used to be
否定和疑问：There isn't... / Is there...?

mistakes.wrong: There have a book on the desk.
mistakes.correct: There is a book on the desk.
mistakes.explanation: There be结构用be动词，不用have

mistakes.wrong: There are a pen and two books.
mistakes.correct: There is a pen and two books.
mistakes.explanation: 就近原则：be动词由最近的名词a pen决定

mistakes.wrong: There has a lot of water.
mistakes.correct: There is a lot of water.
mistakes.explanation: water是不可数名词，用is

examples: There are many students in the classroom.
Is there a hospital near here?
There will be a meeting tomorrow.

grammar.title: 一般将来时
grammar.definition: 表示将来某一时刻将要发生的动作或存在的状态，也表示将来经常或反复发生的动作。
grammar.structure: 主语 + will/shall + 动词原形 或 主语 + be going to + 动词原形
usage: will表示临时决定或预测：I will help you.
be going to表示计划或有迹象要发生：Look at the clouds. It's going to rain.
shall用于第一人称的提议：Shall we go now?

mistakes.wrong: I will going to school.
mistakes.correct: I will go to school.
mistakes.explanation: will后面直接加动词原形，不加to或-ing

mistakes.wrong: She is go to leave.
mistakes.correct: She is going to leave.
mistakes.explanation: be going to结构中，be动词后接going

examples: We will have a meeting tomorrow.
I'm going to visit my uncle next week.
It will be sunny this afternoon.

grammar.title: 现在进行时
grammar.definition: 表示现在正在进行的动作，也可表示现阶段正在进行或即将发生的动作。
grammar.structure: 主语 + am/is/are + 动词-ing
usage: 表示说话时正在进行的动作：He is reading a book now.
表示现阶段正在进行的动作：She is learning French this year.
表示即将发生的动作（常用go, come, leave等）：I am leaving tomorrow.
与always连用表示赞扬或不满：He is always helping others.

mistakes.wrong: She is play the piano.
mistakes.correct: She is playing the piano.
mistakes.explanation: be动词后面要用动词的-ing形式

mistakes.wrong: I am knowing the answer.
mistakes.correct: I know the answer.
mistakes.explanation: know是状态动词，一般不用进行时

examples: They are watching TV at the moment.
We are having an English class now.

sub_topics.title: 现在进行时的用法
sub_topics.definition: 表示正在进行或现阶段正在发生的动作
usage: 表示说话时正在发生的动作
表示现阶段持续的动作
examples: She is studying English these days.

grammar.title: 现在完成时
grammar.definition: 表示过去发生的动作对现在造成的影响或结果，也表示从过去持续到现在的动作或状态。
grammar.structure: 主语 + have/has + 过去分词
usage: 表示过去的动作对现在的影响：I have lost my key. (现在没有钥匙)
表示经历：Have you ever been to Beijing?
表示持续到现在的状态：I have lived here for 10 years.
常与already, yet, just, ever, never, for, since连用

mistakes.wrong: I have see the movie.
mistakes.correct: I have seen the movie.
mistakes.explanation: have/has后面要用动词的过去分词形式

mistakes.wrong: I have bought this book yesterday.
mistakes.correct: I bought this book yesterday.
mistakes.explanation: 有具体过去时间（yesterday），不能用现在完成时

mistakes.wrong: He has gone to Beijing for 3 days.
mistakes.correct: He has been in Beijing for 3 days.
mistakes.explanation: have gone表示去了还没回来，不能与for连用

examples: She has already finished her homework.
I have never met him before.
We have known each other since 2020.

sub_topics.title: 现在完成时的基本结构
sub_topics.definition: 表示过去发生并对现在有影响
usage: 强调结果或经验

sub_topics.title: have/has + 过去分词
sub_topics.definition: 构成现在完成时。
usage: 表示完成或经验

sub_topics.title: 现在完成时结构
sub_topics.definition: 表示过去发生并影响现在的动作
usage: 经验
结果
持续

sub_topics.title: have + 过去分词
sub_topics.definition: 在阅读方面有困难

sub_topics.title: 现在完成时结构（have/has + 过去分词）
sub_topics.definition: 表示过去发生的动作对现在有影响
sub_topics.structure: 主语 + have/has + 过去分词
usage: 强调结果或经历
常与 already, ever 连用

sub_topics.title: 现在完成时的用法
sub_topics.definition: 表示过去发生的动作对现在产生影响
sub_topics.structure: 主语 + have/has + 过去分词
usage: 表示已完成的动作
表示经验或结果

grammar.title: 定语从句
grammar.definition: 在复合句中修饰名词或代词的从句，通常紧跟在被修饰的词（先行词）之后。
grammar.structure: 先行词 + 关系词(who/which/that/whose/where/when) + 从句
usage: who/that指人：The man who/that is talking is my father.
which/that指物：The book which/that I bought is interesting.
whose表所属：The girl whose mother is a doctor is my friend.
where指地点：This is the school where I studied.
when指时间：I still remember the day when I met you.

mistakes.wrong: The man which is talking is my teacher.
mistakes.correct: The man who/that is talking is my teacher.
mistakes.explanation: 先行词是人时，用who或that，不用which

mistakes.wrong: The book who I bought is good.
mistakes.correct: The book which/that I bought is good.
mistakes.explanation: 先行词是物时，用which或that，不用who

mistakes.wrong: This is the place where I visited.
mistakes.correct: This is the place which/that I visited.
mistakes.explanation: visit是及物动词，需要宾语，用which/that而非where

examples: I have a friend who can speak five languages.
The movie that we saw last night was exciting.
I'll never forget the day when I graduated.

sub_topics.title: 定语从句（that引导）
sub_topics.definition: that引导从句修饰名词
usage: that作主语或宾语
examples: The book that I like is interesting.

sub_topics.title: 名词 + 定语从句
sub_topics.definition: 在阅读方面有困难

sub_topics.title: 定语从句（后置定语）
sub_topics.definition: 修饰名词的从句，通常放在名词后
sub_topics.structure: 名词 + 关系词 + 从句
usage: that / who / which 等
examples: The boy who is reading is my brother.

grammar.title: 宾语从句
grammar.definition: 在复合句中作宾语的从句，通常放在主句谓语动词、介词或形容词之后。
grammar.structure: 主句 + 引导词(that/wh-/if/whether) + 陈述语序
usage: that引导（可省略）：I think (that) he is right.
wh-词引导：I don't know what his name is.
if/whether引导：I wonder if/whether he will come.
注意宾语从句要用陈述语序

mistakes.wrong: I don't know where is he.
mistakes.correct: I don't know where he is.
mistakes.explanation: 宾语从句要用陈述语序，不用疑问语序

mistakes.wrong: He asked me that where I lived.
mistakes.correct: He asked me where I lived.
mistakes.explanation: 特殊疑问词引导时不需要that

mistakes.wrong: I wonder if will he come.
mistakes.correct: I wonder if he will come.
mistakes.explanation: if引导的宾语从句要用陈述语序

examples: I believe that you can do it.
Could you tell me how I can get to the station?
I'm not sure whether it will rain tomorrow.

sub_topics.title: what + 宾语从句
sub_topics.definition: 使某人变得……

sub_topics.title: 宾语从句作宾语
sub_topics.definition: 用句子作宾语
sub_topics.structure: 主语 + 谓语 + 连词 + 从句
usage: 表达观点事实
examples: I know that he is right.

grammar.title: 介宾短语
grammar.definition: 介宾短语
grammar.structure: 介词后接名词或动名词

sub_topics.title: 介词后接名词或动名词
sub_topics.definition: 介词后不能直接接动词原形
usage: 常考语法点

sub_topics.title: 介词短语
sub_topics.definition: 由介词+宾语构成
usage: 作定语或状语

sub_topics.title: 介词后接名词
sub_topics.definition: 介词后必须接名词或动名词
usage: 表示时间地点方式等

grammar.title: 连词
grammar.definition: 连词
grammar.structure: 句子连接词

sub_topics.title: 连词and连接并列句
sub_topics.definition: and用于连接并列成分或句子
usage: 表示顺承或并列
examples: I like English and I study it every day.

sub_topics.title: 并列连词and合并句子
sub_topics.definition: 用and连接同一主语或相关句子
usage: 避免重复主语
examples: He stood up and left the room.

sub_topics.title: 连接词and的用法
sub_topics.definition: and用于连接并列的词、短语或句子。
usage: 连接并列成分
表示顺承关系

sub_topics.title: 并列连词and的用法
sub_topics.definition: 用于连接并列的词、短语或句子
usage: 连接两个并列成分
连接两个并列句
examples: He opened the door and went out.

sub_topics.title: 连接词的使用
sub_topics.definition: 连接词用于连接单词、短语或句子，使句子结构更完整、逻辑更清晰。
sub_topics.structure: 连词 + 单词 / 短语 / 句子
usage: 并列连词连接并列成分，如 and, but, or
从属连词引导从句，如 because, when, if, that
连接词后面可以接完整句子
避免句子之间缺少连接词导致结构错误
examples: He stayed at home because it was raining.
She knows that he is right.

grammar.title: 构词法
grammar.definition: 构词法
grammar.structure: 形容词+名词构词法（proper → preparation）

sub_topics.title: 形容词+名词构词法（proper → preparation）
sub_topics.definition: 通过词缀将词性发生变化，常见为动词/形容词变名词
sub_topics.structure: 动词/形容词 + 名词后缀
usage: -tion, -ment 等常见后缀
词义相关但词性变化

sub_topics.title: 动词变名词（manage → management）
sub_topics.definition: 通过后缀将动词转化为名词
usage: 表示行为或过程
常用于抽象概念

sub_topics.title: 动词变名词/人（manage → manager）
sub_topics.definition: 表示“做某事的人”
usage: 表示职业或身份

sub_topics.title: 邀请类动词后接不定式
sub_topics.definition: 表示邀请、请求、建议他人去做某事
sub_topics.structure: invite / ask + sb. + to do sth.
usage: 不能接 doing
强调将来动作
examples: She invited me to join the party.

grammar.title: 连词和介词的区别
grammar.definition: 连词用于连接两个相同成分或句子；介词用于连接动词或形容词与名词（或名词性成分）。
grammar.structure: 连词 + 同类成分；动词/形容词 + 介词 + 名词
usage: 连词连接主语、谓语、宾语等同类成分，如 A and B。
介词后面必须接名词或名词性结构，如 with me, in the room。
不能用连词直接连接动词和名词。

grammar.title: 实义动词的用法
grammar.definition: 实义动词表示具体动作或状态，有词义变化，可作谓语，有时态和人称变化。
grammar.structure: 主语 + 实义动词（根据时态变化）
usage: 一般现在时第三人称单数要加 s 或 es。
构成否定句和疑问句时需要借助助动词 do, does, did。
可以带宾语或不定式等结构，如 need to do sth.。

grammar.title: 省略句
grammar.definition: 在特定语境中，为避免重复或使表达简洁，省略句中某些成分，但意思仍然完整明确。
grammar.structure: （主语）+ 谓语 + 其他成分（部分成分可省略）
usage: 常在口语或对话中出现。
可省略主语、谓语或其他已知成分。
省略部分必须在上下文中可以补全。
examples: I like apples and he (likes) bananas.
When (you are) in Rome, do as the Romans do.

grammar.title: be used to与used to的区别
grammar.definition: used to 表示过去常常做某事；be used to 表示习惯于某事或做某事。
grammar.structure: used to do sth.; be used to doing sth.
usage: used to 只用于过去时。
be used to 中的 to 是介词，后接名词或动名词。
be used to 可用于各种时态。
examples: He is used to getting up early.
They were used to the cold weather.

grammar.title: 双重所有格
grammar.definition: 同时使用 of 结构和名词所有格表示所属关系，常强调“其中之一”。
grammar.structure: a/an + 名词 + of + 名词's
usage: 常用于表示某人众多物品中的一个。
of 后必须接名词所有格或名词性物主代词。

grammar.title: 词法和句法
grammar.definition: 词法研究词的构成和变化；句法研究词在句子中的组合和结构。
grammar.structure: 词法：词根 + 词缀；句法：词 + 短语 + 句子
usage: 词法关注构词方式，如派生、复合。
句法关注句子成分和结构，如主谓宾。

grammar.title: 名词的可数与不可数
grammar.definition: 可数名词有单复数形式；不可数名词通常没有复数形式，不能直接与 a/an 连用。
grammar.structure: 可数名词：a/an + 单数；不可数名词：不可直接加 a/an
usage: 可数名词复数通常加 s 或 es。
不可数名词可用量词表示数量，如 a piece of advice。

grammar.title: 不定代词后置形容词
grammar.definition: 当形容词修饰 something, anything, nothing 等不定代词时，形容词要放在其后。
grammar.structure: 不定代词 + 形容词
usage: 适用于 something, anything, nothing, everything 等。
形容词不能放在不定代词前。

grammar.title: y结尾形容词比较级变化规则
grammar.definition: 以辅音字母加 y 结尾的形容词，比较级变 y 为 i 再加 er。
grammar.structure: 形容词（辅音+y）→ 去 y + ier
usage: 适用于 happy, easy, busy 等。
若 y 前为元音字母，则直接加 er。

grammar.title: 简单句
grammar.definition: 只包含一个主谓结构的句子。
grammar.structure: 主语 + 谓语 + 其他成分
usage: 表达一个完整意思。
不包含从句。

grammar.title: 复合句
grammar.definition: 由两个或两个以上的分句构成的句子，包括并列句和主从复合句。
grammar.structure: 分句 + 连词 + 分句
usage: 可用 and, but 等连接并列句。
可用 that, because 等引导从句。
examples: I was tired, so I went to bed.
She said that she was happy.

grammar.title: good和 well 的比较级形式
grammar.definition: (good和 well 的比较级形式)较好的
